snippet: The history of Silicon Valley suggests that expensive purchases of start-ups by start-ups may not always be so crazy.
abstract: Facebook's $1 billion purchase of Instagram surprises some with its high price tag for a company with no revenue, but the history of Silicon Valley suggests that expensive purchases of start-ups may not be out of line; PayPal and YouTube are examples of high-priced tech purchases that originally had investors guessing, but became hugely profitable; such acquisitions are often made to gain something valuable, while staving off competition.

byline.original: By SOMINI SENGUPTA and NICK BILTON

lead_paragraph: The history of Silicon Valley suggests that expensive purchases of start-ups by start-ups may not always be so crazy.

headline.seo: Facebook Plays Offense and Defense by Buying Instagram
headline.main: Facebook Plays Offense and Defense in a Single Deal
headline.print_headline: Facebook Plays Offense and Defense in a Single Deal
